humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the size of the largest tumor, which is 2.1 cm. Based on the rules provided, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of a cancer is determined by the size of the primary tumor. In this report, the primary tumor is described as 'INVASIVE LOBULAR CARCINOMA, moderately differentiated, Nottingham grade 2 (3+2+1=6), 2.1 cm. in. greatest dimension.' This indicates that the size of the tumor is 2.1 cm, which falls within the T2 category (tumor size > 20 mm but < 50 mm in greatest dimension) according to the TNM staging system.
